dnimp
Class Statistics

java.lang.Object
  dnimp.Statistics

public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object

A statistics module for the MetCor implementation of different trajectory statistics models. Functions include returning varying t-values, signal smoothing and matrix to vector (+ vice versa) transformations. To be used by CMCRender, World and Grid classes of the dnimp package.

          An empty constructor for the Statistics module.

Method Detail

smoothData

public double[] smoothData(double[] rawData,
                           int filterLength,
                           int polyDegree)
The main smoothing algorithm used by MetCor.

Parameters:
rawData - the raw data to be passed as a vector, to be mapped back to CWT-matrices by the invoking class
filterLength - an odd-numbered length representing 2N+1 (the filter length), where N are the left and right bounds used for data smoothing. Generally, the larger the filter, the greater the smoothing effect.
polyDegree - the degree of the polynomial to fit into the data, should also be user controlled. REQUIRES: filterLength%2 = 1, i.e. filterLength is odd.

AStudT

public double AStudT(double p,
                     int n)
Computes a given t-value for a specific probability (p) and degrees of freedom (n). Note that p represents a two-tailed distribution area. Conversion to a one-tailed distribution area is left to the user's intepretation

Parameters:
p - the two tailed distribution area: 1 - CI, where CI is the confidence interval.
n - degrees of freedom

haversineV

public double haversineV(double x,
                         double y,
                         double xR,
                         double yR)
Returns the linear distance between 2 geographical coordinates; for sQTBA

Parameters:
x - Latitude
y - Longitude
xR - receptor site latitude
yR - receptor site longitude

naturalTransPot

public double naturalTransPot(double Taux,
                              double sqrtV,
                              double a)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the natural transport potential function for a given back trajectory.

Parameters:
T - temporal distance from receptor site
sqrtV - spatial distance away from receptor site, see this.haversineV(...)
a - atmospheric dispersion factor
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] Args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Testing only.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
